Typealiases.html#/s:31RVS_BTDriver_MacOS.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Device_ViewController_TableDataTuple
Typealiases.html#/s:31RVS_BTDriver_MacOS.abstract: This is a handy typealias for the tuple we’ll use to transmit table data.

Typealiases.html#/s:31RVS_BTDriver_MacOS.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Properties_ViewController_TableDataTuple
Typealiases.html#/s:31RVS_BTDriver_MacOS.abstract: This is a handy typealias for the tuple we’ll use to transmit table data.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:3.name: isEmpty
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:3.abstract: Returns true, if yes, we have no bananas.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:3.name: count
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:3.abstract: The number of elements we have. 1-based. 0 is no elements (isEmpty is true).

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.name: RVS_SequenceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.abstract: If you conform to this protocol, you get a few basic Sequence attributes for free.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.name: firstUppercased
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.abstract: This extension lets us uppercase only the first letter of the string (used for weekdays).

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.name: urlEncodedString
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.abstract: The following computed property comes from this: http://stackoverflow.com/a/27736118/879365

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.name: index(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.abstract: This allows us to find the first index of a substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.name: endIndex(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.abstract: This allows us to find the last index of a substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.name: indexes(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.abstract: This returns an Array of indexes that map all the occurrences of a given substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.name: ranges(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy31RV.abstract: This returns an Array of Index Ranges that map all the occurrences of a given substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html.name: StringProtocol
Extensions/StringProtocol.html.abstract: These are a variety of cool String extensions that add some great extra cheese on the pizza.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: prefs
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: These are the shared persistent prefs for the test harness app.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: appDelegateObject
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This is an accessor to our app delegate object. READ-ONLY

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: driverInstance
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This is our instance of the actual BLE driver. We fetch it from the app delegate. READ-ONLY

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: Called after the view has loaded and initialized from the storyboard.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: _driverInstance
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This is the internal holder for the driver instance. It is initialized as a singleton, the first time it’s accessed.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: appDelegateObject
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This is a quick way to get this object instance (it’s a SINGLETON), cast as the correct class.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: driverInstance
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This is our instance of the actual BLE driver.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: mainDisplayScreen
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: A convenient store for a reference to the main display table.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: isScanning
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This indicates that the driver is scanning for new devices. If set to true, and the driver is initialized, the driver will start scanning (unless it is already scanning).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: isBTAvailable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: Returns true, if bluetooth is available. READ-ONLY

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: setUpDriver()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This establishes the driver instance, wiping out any old one.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: displayAlert(header:message:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This displays a simple alert, with an OK button.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: btDriver(_:encounteredThisError:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: Simple error reporting method.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: btDriver(_:newDeviceAdded:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: Called when a new device is discovered while scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: btDriverStatusUpdate(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver’s status should be checked.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: btDriverScanningChanged(_:isScanning:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver started or stopped scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.name: useDifferentThread
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.abstract: This is the key for the “Use A Different Thread” pref.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.name: continuousScan
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.abstract: This is the key for the “Keep Scanning and Include Duplicates” pref.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.name: persistentConnections
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs/.abstract: This is the key for “persistent connections.” The device remains connected, once discovered.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..name: keys
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..abstract: An Array of String, containing the keys used to store and retrieve the values from persistent storage.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: incorrectKeys(invalidElements:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Some elements were presented that do not fit our keys. The associated value is an Array of the failing keys.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: valuesNotPlistCompatible(invalidElements:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Not all of the elements in the _values Dictionary are Plist-Compatible. The associated value is an Array of the failing keys.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: noStoredPrefsForKey(key:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: We were not able to find a stored pref for the given key. The associated value is the key we are looking for.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: unknownError(error:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Unknown thrown error. The associated value is the error (if any).

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: _values
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This is the Dictionary. It’s private, and shouldn’t need to be accessed outside this base class.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: _save()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This is a private method that saves the current contents of the _values Dictionary to persistent storage, keyed by the value of the “key” property.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: _load()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This is a private method that reads in the data from persistent storage for this instance (using the “key” property), and loads the _values Dictionary property.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.name: PrefsError
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs/PrefsError.h.abstract: Errors that Can be thrown from methods in this class

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: key
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This is the key that is used to store and fetch the collection of data to be used to populate the _values Dictionary.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: lastError
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This is any error that was thrown during a save or a load.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: keys
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This computed property MUST be overridden by subclasses.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.name: values
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.abstract: This is an accessor for the _values Dictionary. Before it returns the Dictionary, it loads data from persistent storage.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This is a direct-access subscript that allows you to use the prefs object to reach its stored properties.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.name: init()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/c:@M@R.abstract: The default initializer uses the current subclass typename as the main key.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: init(key:values:)
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: You can initialize instances with a key and some initial data values.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.name: clear()
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html#/s:31RV.abstract: This clears the values, and deletes the pref from the UserDefaults.

Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html.name: RVS_PersistentPrefs
Classes/RVS_PersistentPrefs.html.abstract: This class is designed to act as an “abstract” base class, providing a simple Dictionary datastore that is stored in the UserDefaults in the Application Bundle. It is designed to be reliable, and extremely simple to use.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..name: RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Test_Harness_Prefs..abstract: This class extends the prefs class to provide persistent prefs storage. This is used across all test harnesses.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_AppDelegate
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class is the main application delegate.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_About_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class controls the main listing screen (the one that displays a list of devices).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Base_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class provides some common tools for all view controllers.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Base_WindowController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: The main reason for creating this class was to allow us to interpret settings, and to fix an issue with Interface Builder.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Device_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class controls the device info listing screen (the one that displays a list of device information).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Main_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class controls the main listing screen (the one that displays a list of devices).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Properties_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class controls the properties info listing screen (the one that displays a list of individual properties).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.name: RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_Settings_ViewController
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_MacOS_Test_Harness_.abstract: This class controls the main listing screen (the one that displays a list of devices).

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
